titleStmt.title: Of the Quakers despising the holy scriptures As appears in their preachers printed books, as follows; collected in the fear of the Lord, for no other end, but to move the Quakers to get all their errors retracted, and to caution all others against them.
titleStmt.author: Mather, W. (William), fl. 1695.

publicationStmt.publisher: reprinted for B. Aylmer, at the Three Pidgeons in Cornhill, and C. Brome, at the Gun, at the West End of St. Paul's Church-yard,

notesStmt.note: Signed at end: W. Mather (of Bedford) who was a Quaker above forty years, but is now returned to Christianity.
With verse and woodcut illustration at head: "Come, and behold (a thing most true,) ..
At head: The third edition corrected with some additions.
Reproduction of the original in the Christ Church Library, Oxford.

place.placeName: the Gun, at the West End of St. Paul's Church-yard
